alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Garfield; Grant; Kay; Major; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:54AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kay, northwestern Noble, Alfalfa, southern Grant, Garfield and northeastern Major Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 154 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Helena to 3 miles northwest of Enid to 3 miles southeast of Covington. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enid, Perry, Cherokee, Helena, Pond Creek, Garber, Covington, Billings, Carmen, Red Rock, Kremlin, Goltry, Breckenridge, Jet, Aline, Nash, Hunter, Burlington, Fairmont, and Hillsdale. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 186 and 206. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Alfalfa; Garfield; Grant; Kay; Major; Noble
